summary: A large detailed custom fortress sited on the large waterfall in the Rift near Darkwater Pass. Complete with vendor hall, NPC tavern (3 custom NPCs) and player equipment armoury.
descriptionHtml:
This mod adds a large fort complex named Darkwater Overlook to the exterior Darkwater Pass waterfall. Main structures are built into the existing landscape and mountainside with a full view of Eastmarch and Windhelm. Currently, only assets from Skyrim have been used to create this mod, expansions are not required to play.

Key features include:

Vendor Hall -
Heavy armour vendor selling all heavy armour sets and 1h/2h weapons.
Light armour vendor selling all light armour sets, bows and ammunition.
Blacksmith vendor selling all armourer crafting items (all ingots etc.).
Ingredients vendor selling all ingredient items.
Jewelery vendor selling rings, necklaces, gems and dragon priest masks.
Mage vendor selling all spell tomes, staves, soul gems and robes.

Crafting stations are placed by their respective vendors.


Armoury -
The Armoury is a large building containing a number of item display objects and player storage chests. Rows of weapon display cabinets, wall mounted weapon plaques and armour mannequins are stored in the left part of the hall, misc chest storage in the right.

NPC Tavern -
A small tavern with a barkeep vendor and 3 followers.


Access to and from the lower waterfalls -
For when you don\'t want to jump off the waterfall...



Installation:
Only 1 Esp file, extract to the skyrim/data directory and activate from the Skyrim data files menu or activate with NMM

Currently known mod conflicts:
This mod will of course conflict with any other building or landscape mod in the same location, below is a list of mods that will conflict.

-Dragon Falls Manor




Required Mods:

ApachiiSkyHair - http://skyrim.nexusmods.com/mods/10168/?



Further Development:
I may add content from Dawnguard and Dragonborn in the future and polish up exisiting areas as I do so. Player storage and displays will be left as they are so the mod can easily be updated without messing up existing saves.

Additionally:
-Expanding on the armoury for extra storage depending on player feedback.
-Adding more follower NPCs to the tavern.
-Access to the very top and bottom of the waterfall probably through the existing hub.
author: Sergeant Cortez
